intro: Bonnaya clausa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bonnaya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Bonnaya clausa is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining wetland ecosystems.
